subclusters.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
Caloric Restriction and Metabolic Regulation Disposable Soma Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on evolutionary trade-offs between reproduction and somatic maintenance, stochastic damage accumulation, and polygenic control of maintenance.
Emphasizes soma as disposable vehicle for germline, evolutionary trade-offs, and lack of selection post-reproduction.
Describes nutrient allocation trade-offs between reproduction and somatic repair, with lifespan extension upon reduced reproduction.
Highlights genetic regulation of maintenance and evolutionary trade-offs between reproduction and somatic maintenance.
Focuses on evolutionary basis of aging, metabolic costs of maintenance, and stochastic damage accumulation.
Discusses resource allocation trade-offs and evolutionary logic of aging as a byproduct of energy allocation.
Shows inverse relationship between reproduction and lifespan due to resource allocation trade-offs.
Describes soma as service compartment of germ cells and evolutionary trade-offs shaping lifespan.
Explains lifespan differences in eusocial insects via resource allocation and reproductive roles.
Focuses on trade-offs between reproduction and somatic maintenance and nutrient signaling pathways influencing lifespan.
Centers on insulin/IGF-1 signaling pathway regulating aging and immunity via DAF-2/DAF-16 axis.
Describes IIS pathway's role in immune aging and longevity through transcriptional feedback loops.
Focuses on IIS regulation of reproductive and somatic aging via DAF-2 and DAF-16.
Highlights central role of IIS and DAF-16 in longevity and metabolic resource allocation.
Details IIS regulation of longevity through protein phosphorylation and multilayered control.
Describes IIS pathway's role in neuronal aging and preservation of neuronal function.
Explores IIS paradox linking aging, proteotoxicity, and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormonal regulation of somatic maintenance and immune function in social insects linking reproduction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes transcription factor TCER-1 linking reproductive system signals to lifespan extension via DAF-16.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains gonadal longevity pathway trade-offs between somatic proteostasis and reproduction mediated by lysosomal lipase LIPL-4.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes lysosomal acidification regulated by DAF-16 and steroid hormones couples reproduction to somatic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reproductive Hormonal Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links reproductive aging to somatic aging via accumulation of uterine proteins after reproductive decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Metabolic Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on calorie restriction modulating nutrient sensing pathways and sirtuins to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Metabolic Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR effects on lifespan extension and delay of age-related diseases across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Metabolic Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR-induced metabolic changes in adipose tissue and activation of metabolic regulators influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Metabolic Regulation Disposable Soma Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links TCA cycle enzyme idha-1, dietary restriction, and TOR signaling in lifespan and oxidative stress regulation.
